comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Nice one.  I see that the Sergeants had their stripes on the cuffs of their sleeves?  The Inspector has a similar uniform but with a badge of some sort on his sleeve and carried a walking stick.  Not sure where the Courthouse was but the Waterford Garda Station was on Adelphi Quay up until relatively recently.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Have a look on our Flickr Map. It's on the corner of Otteran Place and Catherine Street - the front is awfully imposing with pillars, etc. so this must have been taken at a side entrance...

comment._content: This was the rear entrance to the courthouse of 1841. This entrance was lost when the building was extended/redeveloped in c1980
